summary: When Xerxes (Ken Davitian), the evil god king of Persia, sends his massive army to Sparta, King Leonidas (Sean Maguire) and 13 strapping warriors rise up to defend their homeland. Leonidas, Captain (Kevin Sorbo) and the rest face down dancing Persians, bad punch-lines and celebrity look-alikes.

This is one of my favorites comedy movies. I just can't get enough and watch it a lot of times!
The worst movie I have ever seen; dull and ridiculous.

The people giving this movie one star are boring and stale humans that are completely boring at any party. This movie is obviously meant to be a complete comedic mess. Meet the Spartans was one of the last great satire spin offs. In today's society a movie like Meet the Spartans could never be made. Thank you to the cast and crew for making my childhood great with this film! Me and friends loved it back in the day and still do in uni!
Its a dumb movie but it was funny when I was a kid so eh

What can I say about this movie that's good?
Carmen Electra was pretty hot in it, but as with most parody movies, they take a well known film, in this case 300 and proceed to make it with terrible jokes and sight gags.  I'm not sure if it's law that these are supposed to be as unfunny as possible, but it wouldn't hurt to at least be clever. 
Terrible

The standard Seltzer/Friedberg formula.

1. A stand in for a famous actor or celebrity pops in.

2. Someone in the movie condescendingly announces the name of said character or celebrity in case the audience is too dumb to get the obvious reference.

3. Actor impersonating character or celebrity recites a line that the character or celebrity made famous. Context doesn't matter.

4.  The character or celebrity being "lampooned" starts to breakdance.

5. Character or celebrity falls down.

6. Steps 1-5 are repeated until the movie ends.
movie that even has cool scenes but the script doesn't help and the characters are silly, crude, cheesy and beasts that end up not having much fun and that makes the film more depressing than funny.
just another scary movie rip/spin-off. not that funny, but if you smoke it'll probably be hilarious
A very bad parody film that has no funny moments, godawful acting, parodies too much things at once, and is a perfect example of crime against cinema.
I really don't get the low reviews.  Maybe its just not for everyone. Not all the jokes land (like any parody) but there are some seriously funny bits that makes this film well worth watching.
As a parody of 300 and many other blockbusters, it's tired, unoriginal, dated, unfunny, boring, offensive and uninspired.
If these Spartans try to introduce themselves RUN!!! The film has as many laughs as the real 300.

Typical Friedberg spoof of the 300 Zack Snyder movie. Riddled with many unnecessary pop culture references, some even dated at the time, also unfunny homophobic and racist jokes. One of the worst movies I've ever seen.
Who knew a spoof could be this unfunny and boring.

Why bother writing a detailed review on Meet the Spartans? You know how the story goes: the acting is awful, the production values are abysmal and Friedberg & Seltzer mistake pop culture references to whatever was trending at the time for actual humour. They're not even researched well since they only look at trailers and production notes. I cringed when they called the Cosmic Cube the "Transformers Cube". Seriously, the reviews for these awful parody films, with the possible exception of Date Movie, are interchangeable. I'd express relief that this 300 "parody" is short but they pad out the runtime with an end-credits sequence with a decent amount of deleted scenes. Yeah, Meet the Spartans is that bad, people. But it is at least 5% better than the aptly named Disaster Movie.
Stupid 300 parody! It's worse than Disaster Movie!
On the better side of the worst movies ever made
Wow oh wow. It's some of the worst writing I've ever seen. Is it possible to give it zero stars?
Honestly its a funny movie
Cool. Like a mirror of 300. But, clear by a true hilarious prism vision . 300 was distorted.
It sucks because it's a ripoff of 300! Even though I'm neutral over 300.
Appreciate the parody, but it overwhelms every aspect from being a biographical film
Funny, heartfelt and occasionally involving, Meet The Spartans is a perfectly crafted comedy that remains sharp and incisive more than 10 years after its release.

If you've watched 300, you need to watch Meet the Spartans. It is a silly and irreverent film that fantastically parodies the amazing 300. 

Definitely the best of the parody movies with maybe the exception of Scary Movie.

This is pretty much the comprehensive demonstration of complete trash. Easy, cheap, incoherent humor with a seemingly built in randomizer. The only part that interested me at all was that Carmen Electra apparently consented to a crabs joke, and that she was a whore. Alongside old tired jokes such as making fun of Brittany Spears' shaving her head, and Simon Cowells' legendary bitter judgment of talent, you have to wonder why she would consent to basically being the reason feminism exists and risking it have a grain of truth like the others.
One of the most funny parody movie's ever. It was so much fun that i cried tears the hole movie xD

It's a shame, the main actor actually has range. Actually, the acting is not bad overall (bit over the lines perhaps), it's just that there are no actual jokes in the movie, so it's unfunny and boring.
One man's trash is another man's treasure. /shrug
what were they thinking when they were making this movie? I mean this movie is a total disgrace. I didn't even laugh even once while watching this movie.
i'm only giving this an extra half star because i liked it... when i was 12. but now, it's crude, disgusting and unfunny. if you haven't seen it... don't.
This is the first of the spoof movies that I saw. I haven't seen another spoof movie after this and any Scary Movie also. Stay away.

It's just as bad as you think, Very poor silly jokes, Poor acting but I did laugh a few times and the mocking of the slow motion scene from the film was great and really funny but apart from that it's another spoof film that nobody asked for.
A film with stupid, unfunny, horrible jokes, laughable acting, pitiful writing and aimless direction. A cinematic shame and terrible entry in the comedy genre..

I expected this to be really bad...and it was. However, I've seen some of the other crappy movies made by the same writers of this one and at I can say this one was somewhat watchable. There are some parts that are kind of funny, but nothing that made me laugh out loud. 

The thing I hate most is that these guys have a bad habit of shoehorning anything from pop culture into these films. They also tend to blatantly point out what they are referencing - I guess in case the audience is too stupid to recognize it. These guys are capable of creating some funny moments, but they really need to have some quality writers/directors to reel in the painfully unfunny stuff.

Okay it had its comedy. It had its: American idol, Brittney Spears, gay comedy montage. Yes the nipple ripping scene made me feel that. The movie was not very good being a little older to look back at. I loved it at the time, but come on 300 was awesome, great idea to parady it, but some things you should not parady.
This is by far the best movie I have ever seen. The artistic and conventional symbolism is stunning!
The worst movie of the year.....enough said.

A horrible unfunny piece of trash. This is the 3rd worst parody movie I ever saw!

Meet the Spartans is a terrible movie, even compared to the likes of the Scary Movie series or the various teen comedy spoofs. There were very few gags in this movie that worked; the Casino Royale sequence and the movie's brief Grand Theft Auto scene worked well, but otherwise, there is nothing worth seeing here. They just don't make them like they used to; the days of UHF seem long gone, and we're left with Meet the Spartans instead. What a shame.

Meet The Spartans is directed by the same people who brought us Date Movie and Epic Movie, two absolutely terrible and unbearabley unwatchable movies. I honestly went into this movie expecting it to be horrible and that's really what I got. It's honestly old at this point. If you hated Date Movie and Epic Movie, you're most likely going to hate this one too. Another horrified parody.
No!!!!! These writers need to stop!!!!

Seriously, Hollywood's went from the hilarious spoof-classic "Airplane", to this?  Rarely do I come across a "comedy" that leaves me face-palming, and staring at the screen blankly throughout it's running time.  The humor consists of juvenile, disgusting, bizarre, pointless and annoyingly arbitrary gags just for the sake of happening.  Even some of the Scary Movies had funny, guilty pleasure moments; this was just boring, random and stupid.  Meet the Spartans serves as a stamp of approval that the spoof genre has long since run out of gas.

So undeniably horrible it's good

To me, this movie is Epic Movie 2. It's almost as though they put this together from deleted scenes or unused jokes and had enough to fill yet another hour and 20 or so minutes. 
As with the previous Aaron and Jason films... This is not one to rush to watch.

A 300 spoof. Even then, that movie is so easy to spoof and has been done to death even when it was released, that this film coming a few years later already seems dated. It has jokes about Britney's meltdown and American Idol which have been done so many times. Just everything feels like I've seen it before and this film doesn't do much new or funny to make it enjoyable. The effects are bad, the acting is bad, the jokes aren't funny. Just an all around terrible movie.

WTF is this crap? I mean seriously! This is just a disgusting and phenomenal mess of a movie. no rhythm, no pace, a completely stupid plot and unfunny and ridiculous jokes, I'd rather watch an Adam Sandler movie than THIS piece of sh*t. Why did it make so much money? Our society is getting worse and worse.

I can't even believe that my family watched this movie. ALL THE WAY THROUGH! This ridiculous movie shouldn't exist. Do me a favour directors, DO YOUR JOB RIGHT!

A repulsively unfunny piece of shit that actually manages to make "Jaws: The Revenge" look like "Gone With The Wind", Meet The Spartans fails to be a spoof; it has bad acting, unfunny pop-cultural gags, and the plot is non-existent. Friedberg & Seltzer have scraped the bottom of the cinematic spoofs barrel yet again. If you want good satire, watch "Meet The Feebles" instead. (1/10)
